New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 11
Key Match Events: Darius Garland had 18 points, seven assists and hit a floater to put OKC away
Mobley then hit a 10-footer in the lane to put Cleveland up by five
Pre-Game Insights: The matchup was only the third in history between teams riding double-digit winning streaks
The last time it happened was on Jan. 26, 1995, when Seattle and Utah entered their game each on 10-game winning streaks
Post-Match Reflections: Coach's praise for Cleveland's balance, depth, and ability to get by when Mitchell isn’t on
The Cavs extended their winning streak to 11, improved the league’s best record to 32-4 — 11-0 against the West — and moved to 19-1 at home
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game’s intensity had the all vibes of a Finals matchup in June
There were 30 lead changes and neither team led by more than nine
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 points and Jalen Williams had 25 for the Thunder
Isaiah Hartenstein finished with 18 points, 11 rebounds and eight assists
Others: Cleveland showed its balance, depth and that it can get by when Mitchell isn’t on
Mobley and Allen combined for 22 rebounds and 13 assists
